title: How Do I Transfer Discord Server Ownership?

steps.title: Press and hold the server icon and hit More Options.
steps.content: Press and hold the server icon and hit More Options . A gear icon sits next to this option.

steps.title: Tap the Settings button.
steps.content: Tap the Settings button. It also resembles a gear icon.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Members.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Members . This brings you to a full list of all the different members in your server, including bots.

steps.title: Tap the name of the person you’d like to make the server owner.
steps.content: Tap the name of the person you’d like to make the server owner.

steps.title: Hit Transfer Ownership.
steps.content: Hit Transfer Ownership . Follow the onscreen instructions to complete the process.

steps.title: Right-click your server’s icon.
steps.content: Right-click your server’s icon. A smaller menu will pop up near your cursor.

steps.title: Hover over Server Settings.
steps.content: Hover over Server Settings . A submenu will pop up when you hover your mouse.

steps.title: Click Members.
steps.content: Click Members . This will take you to a comprehensive of all the server members, including bots.

steps.title: Click ⋮ next to the user you want to make owner.
steps.content: Click ⋮ next to the user you want to make owner. A small menu will pop up, which includes the option “Transfer Ownership.”

steps.title: Click Transfer Ownership.
steps.content: Click Transfer Ownership . Follow the onscreen instructions to finalize the process.

steps.title: Possibly, but ownership will have to go to an existing server mod or admin.
steps.content: Possibly, but ownership will have to go to an existing server mod or admin. Discord’s support team states that they might turn down server ownership transfer requests related to disabled/banned Discord members. They also don’t allow people to ask for server ownership transfers on someone else’s behalf. You’d have to ask a mod or admin from your old server to submit the request. [1] X Research source Essentially, it’s a gamble if Discord will accept or deny your request.

steps.title: Make sure that you and your server meet the transfer criteria.
steps.content: Make sure that you and your server meet the transfer criteria. Discord’s support team has specific rules in place that decide whether they’ll transfer server ownership: [2] X Research source The requester has to be a mod or admin of the server in question. The old/existing server owner can’t have logged into their account for 1+ months. The requester has logged into and used their Discord account in the past month. The server in question has 100+ total members.

steps.title: Submit a request form to Discord’s support team.
steps.content: Submit a request form to Discord’s support team. While submitting a ticket doesn’t guarantee that your request will be granted, it’s the best chance at getting it seen and addressed by a member of Discord’s team. Here’s how to fill out the request form: What can we help you with? Help & Support Your email address : The email you’d like to use to correspond with Discord Type of question? Server Related Requests Server Related Requests : Server Ownership Transfer Request Server Name : The name of the server Server ID : The ID number attached to the server To find the server ID, turn on “Developer Mode” in the “Advanced” section of your settings. Then, press and hold the server icon, tap “More Options,” and hit “Copy Server ID.” Current Server Owner’s Discord Username : The username of the banned server owner Current Server Owner’s ID : The ID number of the banned server owner To find a person’s user ID, tap and hold on the user’s name, followed by the “...” symbol in the top right of the screen. Then, hit “Copy User ID.” Your Discord Username : The username of the mod or server admin who’ll be receiving ownership Your User ID : The ID number of the mod or server admin who’ll be receiving ownership Server member count : Either “Under 100 Server Members” or “Over 100 Server Members” If your server has less than 100 members, your request will be denied. Is your server Partnered, Verified? “Yes” or “No” Subject : Anything that describes your request well, like “Request for Server Owner Transfership from Banned User” Description : A detailed explanation of the situation that explains how the banned user lost their membership and why the server ownership should be transferred to someone else. Attachments : Include any files that help support any claims you make (like screenshots).

steps.title: Wait at least a day or 2 for Discord to respond.
steps.content: Wait at least a day or 2 for Discord to respond. Discord’s support team doesn’t have a clear response time, but expect to wait at least a couple of days before your request is processed and answered. In some cases, Discord users have waited over a week to hear back from the support team.

steps.title: Make a new account and join the server again.
steps.content: Make a new account and join the server again. Create a new Discord account and request an invitation (or use an old invite link) to your old Discord server.

steps.title: Ask for ownership to be transferred back to you.
steps.content: Ask for ownership to be transferred back to you. Using the steps outlined earlier in this article, ask the existing server owner to transfer ownership back over to you.
